meanings.definition: To force someone to walk forward by holding their arms tightly behind their back.
meanings.sent1: The police frogmarched the criminal out of the building.
meanings.sent2: The guards frogmarched the unruly prisoner to his cell.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student was frogmarched to the principal's office for his prank.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was being frogmarched towards an unknown future.
meanings.sent5: The image of the soldier being frogmarched away stayed with her.

meanings.definition: To move someone forcefully and awkwardly.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind frogmarched the umbrella out of her hands.
meanings.sent2: The bully frogmarched the smaller kid across the playground.
meanings.sent3: The toddler frogmarched his toys around the room in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The heavy boxes frogmarched their way down the narrow hallway.
meanings.sent5: The dancer frogmarched across the stage with purpose.

meanings.definition: To escort or carry someone in a rough or forceful manner.
meanings.sent1: The bodyguards frogmarched the VIP through the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The bouncers frogmarched the troublemaker out of the club.
meanings.sent3: The siblings frogmarched their little brother to bed after he fell asleep on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The protesters were frogmarched out of the building by security.
meanings.sent5: The team frogmarched their injured captain off the field.
